Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to a group of trainer aircraft systems which includes the T-44 and TH-57.  

The T-44 is a twin-engine, multi-seat turboprop aircraft produced by Hawker Beech Aircraft and is utilized to provide training for simulated operation of multi-engine training.  Specifically, this aircraft provides pipeline training for the P-3, P-8, EP-3, KC-130, E-6, E-2, C-2, and MV-22.  Current (FY 2017) Navy inventory is 54 aircraft with service life thru 2025 with possible multiyear extensions.  

The overall goal of modifications for T-44 is to modify and/or upgrade aircraft avionics and associated sub-systems to include upgrades to avionic systems for Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) compliance.  Efforts also include, Avionics modifications to address safety, reliability, maintainability, obsolescence, and Diminishing Manufacturing Source (DMSMS) requirements.  Modifications, particularly to avionic systems, may also be driven by new Cyber Security requirements.   

The TH-57 is a single engine, multi-seat rotary wing aircraft utilized to provide rotary wing training.  Current (FY 2017) Navy TH-57 inventory is 115 aircraft with no documented service life remaining.  The airframe and dynamic components can be sustained indefinitely (although at higher costs as time goes on).

The overall goal of modifications for TH-57 is implement safety updates as well as required upgrades to avionic systems for FAA compliance.  Efforts also include, modifications to airframe, avionics, and sub-systems, necessary to address safety, reliability, maintainability, obsolescence, and Diminishing Manufacturing Source (DMSMS) requirements.  Modifications, particularly to avionic systems, may also be driven by new Cyber Security requirements.

Justification.val:
This submission incorporates corresponding schedule updates throughout the Future Years Defense Program modification efforts with a focus on maintaining ADS-B(Out) procurement and installation schedules to meet 1 January 2020 Federal Aviation Administration compliance deadline for ADS-B(Out).

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $0.275M to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: ADS-B Out

Name.@footnote: 2.1.2) Avionics Cooling Non-Organic:  The A to C conversion has changed the avionics from Analog to Digital in the aircraft.  The Digital avionics require cooling and this modification is necessary to address refrigerant obsolescence of the air conditioning system that supports cooling of those avionics.  This cost element represents kits that will be field level installed via contractor field mod team.
2.2.1) Avionics Obsolescence/DMSMS ECPs NRE: This cost element supports the NRE for FY21-23, funding various avionics ECPs and obsolescence issues resulting from an aging aircraft.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: Avionics Cooling Non-Organic

Description.val:
This Operational Safety Improvement Program (OSIP) funds modifications to T-44 aircraft to provide required Avionics upgrades and address Avionics obsolescence.  

This OSIP includes efforts that address, avionics and supporting sub-system modifications and/or upgrades to address safety, reliability, maintainability, obsolescence, and Diminishing Manufacturing Source (DMSMS) requirements.  Modifications may also be driven by new cyber security requirements.   

This OSIP also funds upgrades to avionic systems necessary for compliance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) 28 May 2010 release DoT/FAA, 14 CFR Part 91: Automated Dependent Surveillance Broadcast (ADS-B) Out performance requirements to support Air Traffic Control (ATC) service final rule. This mandate stipulates that all aircraft required to have unrestricted access to operate in Classes A, B and C airspace; certain Class E airspace, and other specified airspace requiring ADS-B Out, must be in compliance with this regulation by January 1, 2020.

Current Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) include: ADS-B Out; Avionics Cooling; and Avionics Obsolescence/DMSMS.    

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Continue incorporation of engineering change proposals.

Name.@footnote: (3.1) DATA Publications: This cost element funds FY19 publications for multiple ECP products to include the TACAN pubs procurement

(3.4) Other Support: This cost element funds the Other Support; in FY19 increases to support the procurement of TACAN kits which is a complex ECP, and the increase in FY21 supports the increased procurements for various products such as KAPTON Wiring and NVG Cockpit.
1.1.4) Cockpit Camera Mounts:  This cost element represents safety modification that will add cockpit camera mounts to allow recording of flights for safety and training purposes.

1.2.3) KAPTON Wiring Replacement NRE:  This cost element provides non-recurring engineering funding for replacement of KAPTON wiring.  Existing KAPTON wiring in aircraft is beginning to show increased wear, which will require full replacement and retrofit into aircraft rather than repair.
2.1.3) TACAN + R-NAV Replacement:  This cost-element was added to break-out TACAN+R-NAV Replacement B-kit costs.

Installation  Modification Item 1 of 1:  Items that make up this installation group have various manufacturer as well as various Administrative Leadtime and Production Leadtime.  All installations are made by the TH-57 Contractor Logistics Support Provider.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Logistics Support Provider:: Installation Name: OSIP 006-07 TH-57 SAFETY UPGRADE
Kapton Wiring Replacement NRE - Not Installed

Description.val:
This Operational Safety Improvement Program (OSIP) funds modifications to TH-57 aircraft to implement safety updates as well as required upgrades to avionic systems for Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) compliance.

This OSIP includes efforts that address modifications to address safety, reliability, maintainability, obsolescence, and Diminishing Manufacturing Source (DMSMS) requirements.  Modifications include Airframe, sub-systems, and avionics systems.  Modifications, particularly to avionic systems, may also be driven by new cyber security requirements.

This OSIP also funds upgrades to avionic systems necessary for compliance with FAA 28 May 2010 release DoT/FAA, 14 CFR Part 91: Automated Dependent Surveillance Broadcast (ADS-B) Out performance requirements to support Air Traffic Control (ATC) service final rule. This mandate stipulates that all aircraft required to have unrestricted access to operate in Classes A, B, and C airspace; certain Class E airspace, and other specified airspace requiring ADS-B Out, must be in compliance with this regulation by January 1, 2020.

Current Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) include, but are not limited to: ADS-B Out; TACAN+R-NAV Replacement; KAPTON Wiring Replacement; Cockpit Camera Mounts; and Avionics Obsolescence.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Continue incorporation of engineering change proposals.
